Case reference: 2014003402.CaseDesc: Joan Currie was last seen around February 20, 1981. It is believed that she was traveling to Prince Edward Island to visit her parents. She suffers from alcoholism.

Case reference: 2006013799.CaseDesc:
Katherine May Wilson was last seen on October 20, 1970, walking along Harvey Kirkland Road, in Kirkland Lake, Ontario. Extensive searches have failed to locate her.
Barry Manion was arrested on January 6, 2009, and pled guilty to murder on March 11, 2009.  He was sentenced to life in prison for her murder. Katherine's body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2005002899.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2002, the skeletal remains of an adult female were discovered in a heavily wooded area just south of Beagle Club Road off Highway 45 in Alnwick-Haldimand Township, Northumberland County, north of the town of Cobourg. It is believed that death occurred a few months to years prior to discovery. Police are investigating this case as a suspicious death.

Teeth: Evidence of past dental work including metal and white fillings

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2014002914.CaseDesc: Edward Allan Street was last seen at his rooming house on Columbia St in Kamloops, BC.  At around 8:30 am on March 4, 2000, Edward told his friends that he was quickly dropping by his place of work but would be back in time for a meeting at 10:00 am.  His wallet and ID were left inside his room.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Foot, Broken foot as a child
Amputation: Right Ring Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle
Right Middle Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle

Case reference: 2021023948.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2021, David Anthony Gale was seen for the last time at the Independent Grocer in Athabasca, Alberta. David has not been seen or heard from since and police are seeking the public's assistance for any information regarding his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005078.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1992, Gloria Abotossaway was last seen by a family member on Shuter Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002963.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, Nicholas Leonard was seen for the last time rowing a homemade kayak towards the north end of Lower Loon Lake in the town of Wabush, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014001287.CaseDesc: Lawrence Wellington Allard was last seen in December 1975 in Kamloops, British Columbia.  Lawrence has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004882.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2003, at approximately 10:00 am, Feng Lin was seen for the last time after he parked his car at 295 Ossington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Shoulders, Two on the upper left

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2014003135.CaseDesc: On March 28, 1986, Herman Yahyahkeekoot was last seen at his residence, a farm which was a group home.  Mr. Yahyahkeekoot had a history of wandering away from the home. The location is close to the Nesbit Forest which was searched, however, he was never located.

Case reference: 2014003002.CaseDesc: Roger Paul Bertrand left his residence on November 11, 1999, between the hours of 10:00 and 11:30 am. He appeared nervous a week prior to his disappearance due to an upcoming commitment. He was on a disability pension and suffered from back and leg problems which required a brace and a cane to walk.  He left behind his brace and cane at his residence. It appears that Mr. Bertrand may have been a victim of foul play.

Jacket: Leather, Black, With buckles and zippers
Tattoo: Left Hand, Raccoon between the thumb and finger.

Case reference: 2006018799.CaseDesc: Michael Recollet was last seen on August 20, 1991 at Okeechobee Lodge Dock, in Fraser Point. He was  heading in a westerly direction towards Birch Island by boat. His 16 foot cedar strip boat and 25HP Mariner motor were recovered near Mary's Point, Little La Cloche Island.

Case reference: 2009000299.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1989 at approximately 5:30 pm, Mr. George Giles and a friend left Mr. Giles' cottage on Fox Island in Lake Simcoe enroute to a marina at Island Grove.  Weather conditions were very poor at the time and the boat eventually capsized some distance from shore, after taking on water. His friend managed to swim back to Fox Island but Mr. Giles was not able to make it to shore, due to the treacherous weather and water conditions. On November 20th, 1989 the boat was discovered stranded on a sandbank near Joyland Beach in Orillia. Mr. Giles' body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2013000070.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, Serge Jobin was seen for the last time in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. He may have taken a bus to New York City in the United States. Serge is hearing impaired and mute.

Case reference: 2014004667.CaseDesc: The Gypsumville RCMP detachment received a report that an aircraft was in distress over Lake Winnipeg near Reindeer Island. The aircraft, a single engine Cherokee 140, had three people on board; the pilot and two passengers. The pilot had indicated that the engine had seized and that he was trying to make it to Reindeer Island. He then stated that he was going down in to the water. Two RCMP Twin Otters and an Air Search and Rescue Hercules conducted a search by air. It was not possible to search the lake by boat as there was too much ice on the lake. All three are presumed dead due to drowning or from the impact of the crash.

Case reference: 2006028199.CaseDesc: Barbara Sadowski and her husband lived a reclusive lifestyle on Marten Lake, in the Marten River area. She was last seen on the 23 or 24 of June 2006, walking along the beach near her home on Marten Lake.  She was recently in poor health.  She walked at a very slow pace, often using one or two canes or walking sticks.

Hair: Grey, White, Long, Often one or two braids
Teeth: Visible Missing, Poor condition, no teeth, mouth appears sunken
Glasses: Brown, Large frame, older style, thick lenses

Case reference: 2014001925.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1976, Maggie Natomagan, 74 years old, was last seen in Pinehouse, Saskatchewan. Mrs. Natomagan was known to walk in the bush near the community, however, searches failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2006003299.CaseDesc:
On June 16, 2001, the body of a Caucasian male was found near Bayview Avenue, under the Prince Edward Viaduct on Bloor Street East, Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured to be approximately 5’2"-5’5" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  
He has severe emphysema and nicotine staining on his left hand suggesting he may have been a smoker. His appendix was present.

Other: Set of small keys in pocket

Case reference: 2021000934.CaseDesc: On January 25, 2002, Vincent Lamouris was seen for the last time near the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Vincent was despondent.

Watch: White, Wrist watch; brand: Rodania; with a black leather strap
Shoes: Black, Dress shoes; brand: Mephisto; with a buckle on the side
Sweater: Wool, Black, Long sleeves; Ralph Lauren logo on the chest

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.

Case reference: 2014002297.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1983, Dean Martin was seen for the last time at a cottage on Mount Carleton in Carleton-sur-Mer, Quebec. He left the cottage without leaving a note or informing anyone. Dean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006016199.CaseDesc: Erich Striewski left Canada in his sailboat "Rochelle."  He was last seen in Aruba, stocking up with supplies. He left Aruba on February 12, 1992, and intended to sail to Panama. Neither Mr. Striewski or his boat have been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2014006149.CaseDesc: On February 7, 1971,  Selina Wallace spent the day with family and friends socializing. In the evening, Selina and friends went to a pier near the family home. The family last saw Selina on the pier with a male friend. When Selina did not return home the following day, family and community members searched the nearby area. The tidal currents near the pier are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Scar: Right Hand, Circular scar under right thumb, outside of hand

Case reference: 2012020017.CaseDesc: Stephen Begg was reported missing February 16, 2011.  Mr. Begg struggled with alcoholism and depression.

Case reference: 2016060096.CaseDesc: Conrad Roderick Jason Ducharme was reported missing on October 25, 2016, by family members who had not heard from or seen him in two months. Conrad was last known by family to be hitch hiking to a meeting in Dixonville, Alberta in July 2016. He was last seen in Manning, Alberta, in early September 2016.

Case reference: 2005007499.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1985, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 50-60 years, was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist boarding dock. His post-mortem weight was recorded as 127.5lbs. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'3''-5'4''; however, due to traumatic injury this may not accurately represent his actual living height. He was recovered without clothing or personal effects. It is not known how long he had been in the water. A man, similarly described, was seen jumping over the Niagara Falls 5 days prior to the date that this unidentified man was recovered.

Hair: Grey, White, It is unknown whether he had any scalp hair but a few white hairs were noted on the back of his neck
Teeth: Several of his teeth were missing prior to his death and he has some fillings. He also has a cast chrome partial upper denture.
Mark: Left Side Of Head, Raised "age spots" on his head, left cheek and behind his left ear.
Deformity: Upper Left Back, A papilloma (benign non-cancerous tumor) over his left shoulder blade
Scar: Right Pelvis, 2cm right inguinal (groin area) scar

Case reference: 2014007308.CaseDesc: On April 23, 1970, the body of a two to four week old male baby was found on the ice under the bridge on Highway 4, south of Kyle, SK. Investigation failed to identify the infant or suspects. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: On August 18, 1995, Gareth Austin and Dominic Park were seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2021016411.CaseDesc: On June 25, 1979, Lorraine Legault was seen for the last time as she played in front of the home of her grandparents in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005741.CaseDesc: Joseph Angus Morin had been living in Sturgeon Landing, Saskatchewan but left in December 2011, to take up residence in Wanless, MB. Joseph frequently traveled between the communities in the immediate area and was last seen in Cranberry Portage on or about January 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2020011912.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2017, Jeffrey Caporale was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Shortly before his disappearance, Jeffrey had been treated at the University of Alberta hospital.

Case reference: 2014001002.CaseDesc:
On June 27, 1979, the remains of a male were recovered from the Lower Niagara River about one mile south of the Boy Scout Camp and four miles from the St. Catharines Boat Club. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 150-160 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was recovered without clothing or jewelry. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks prior to discovery.

Hair: Brown, Thin dark "Fu Manchu" type mustache
Teeth: Anterior teeth in very good condition, no fillings. Posterior teeth signs of decay and wisdom teeth are absent.

Case reference: 2014002334.CaseDesc: Gary Percival was reported missing in Regina, SK on April 9, 1973. A witness did state that Gary Percival may have been a patient in a hospital in New York State in 1974. Mr. Percival has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020012524.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1993, at approximately 2:45pm, Lois Dunlavy was seen for the last time as she attended the Scarborough General Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. Lois had been examined by a physician and when the physician returned to check on her, she was gone.

Case reference: 2014004183.CaseDesc: Virginia Sampare was last seen on October 14, 1971. Ms. Sampare was despondent over the death of her boyfriend. Ms. Sampare left the residence in the evening of that date and was not seen again.

Shirt: Cotton, Short sleeve navy blue shirt

Case reference: 2012020143.CaseDesc: Lucie Bouchard was last seen on October 23, 1996, driving her 1994 purple Honda Civic. Around 9:45 p.m., she dropped her sister off at the corner of Saint-Michel boulevard and Cremazie East. She was then supposed to head home to Brossard, on the south shore of Montreal, but never made it. She suffers from epilepsy and requires medication. She may have, on average, 2 to 3 epileptic seizures per month.

Case reference: 2022002122.CaseDesc: On January 3, 2022, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Karl Neff was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Port Colborne, Ontario. Karl has ties to the St. Catharines area in Ontario.

Case reference: 2006010399.CaseDesc: William Halverson was last seen getting into a canoe at Bald Indian Bay in Lake of the Woods. He failed to arrive at his destination of Pine Portage Bay.

Case reference: 2019065945.CaseDesc: On November 13, 2019, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Shane Kowerko was seen for the last time as he left a friend’s residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Shane did not tell his friend where he was going, and left his winter jacket there.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Girl holding baseball bat
Right Side Of Neck, Jiminy Cricket
Right Forearm, Chinese writing 5 characters (woman, word, name)

Case reference: 2014003474.CaseDesc: Christine Pelletier was last seen on July 21, 1988, in the Vieux-Rosemont District of Montreal, Quebec. Christine lived with friends, was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle, and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Winged horse on the back of the shoulder. Possibly a Pegasus

Case reference: 2020008393.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1982, David Black was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. David is a chronic cancer patient.

Case reference: 2012020145.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2008, the remains of a man were found floating in the Fraser River near the eastern end of Dyke Road in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had suffered from severe coronary artery disease and it is likely that he may have died a few months to a year prior to the discovery of his remains.

Teeth: False, This person wore complete upper and lower dentures. These "false teeth" were very badly worn.

Case reference: 2014001277.CaseDesc: On July 26, 1987, Sukhminder Singh Grewal was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. He came to Canada and performed as a singer in an East Indian Music Troupe that toured across the country. Sukhminder has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019050955.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2019 the remains of an unidentified man were discovered at 901 King Street West in Toronto, Ontario.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Torso (Front), Healed clavicle and rib fractures

Case reference: 2014002147.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 1981 Churchill RCMP received a call from Mrs. Esmoil advising her two sons, and two friends were late on returning from a canoe trip. On August 18th, 1981, Brian Dean Esmoil, his brother, and two friends headed out on an extended canoe trip from Leaf Rapids to Churchill. Numerous items, belonging to the men were found on shore. The bodies of three of the four travelers were recovered on the Churchilll River and death was due to drowning. The body of Brian Esmoil has never been recovered and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2014043636.CaseDesc: The partial skull of an adult male was found in October 2013 near the "Papa Woods" mountain bike trail near Prince George, British Columbia. It is believed he died several years before his remains were discovered.

Case reference: 2014002472.CaseDesc: In April 1988, Stacey Rogers was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Taylor, British Columbia. Stacey had stated that she was planning on travelling to Edmonton, Alberta, but did not go to Edmonton. It is possible that she went to Grande Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020157.CaseDesc: The partial skeletal remains of this adult male were recovered on a ranch property on Lindley Creek Road in close proximity to the Shulus Indian Reserve in Merritt BC.

Case reference: 2022005356.CaseDesc: On November 25, 2021, Krystine Scott was seen for the last time in Windsor, Ontario. Krystine is known to lead a transient lifestyle, but it is not in her nature to be out of contact with her friends and family for an extended period.

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2014002009.CaseDesc: Leroy Marshall, AKA Roy Marshall, has been missing since July 23, 1979. Mr. Marshall moved in with his sister on the west side of Saint John in June of 1979. He had a job interview with the School District on July 23, 1979 but failed to show. Mr. Marshall lived in Somerville, Massachusetts, US, between 1961 and 1971.

Case reference: 2006026499.CaseDesc: Simon McDonald was last seen on May 9, 2001, leaving his daughter's residence on the White Dog, First Nations Territory. He was known to enjoy walking along the river. Extensive searches of the area have failed to locate Mr. McDonald.

Hair: Black, Grey, Unkempt; Beard, Moustache, Sideburns
Shoes: Cloth, Red, Black, slippers with leather soles.

Case reference: 2014002108.CaseDesc: Craig Waldum along with 7 others were on a canoeing expedition along the Nelson River. Craig was one of two guides on the expedition. On August 18, 1978, three members of the expedition were on shore guiding in a canoe. The remaining 5 members including Craig remained in the canoe. As these individuals labored to guide the canoe to shore, the rope was given some slack. This caused the bow of the canoe to turn out into the current, which in turn caused the canoe to tip. The individuals on shore were unable to hold onto the rope due to the strength of the current and the canoe was carried downstream. Craig hung onto the canoe for a couple hours then was seen letting go. He slipped under the water and did not resurface. Mr. Waldum's remains have not been recovered and foul play is not suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014005064.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1983, Roy Nippi was last seen on the Chagoness/Kinistin First Nation near Tisdale, Saskatchewan. Roy was known to travel throughout western Canada and the western USA, however, searches and inquiries over the years with contacts in those provinces and states have failed to reveal any trace of Roy.

Case reference: 2015022096.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Karrie-Ann Henry was seen for the last time leaving her home with some of her belongings.

Case reference: 2012020099.CaseDesc: Jack (Mike) St. Pierre was last seen on July 17, 2009, at approximately 1:00 p.m. He was on foot southbound from "the point" toward the hamlet of Wollaston Lake. Mr. St. Pierre may have been seen later taking a boat across the Bay at Wollaston Lake. Articles of clothing were located in the water near where he was last thought to have been seen.

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001117.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1999, the body of an adult male was found in a green tent on Cypress Mountain southeast of Eagle Lake in West Vancouver, British Columbia. He used reading glasses, had a short grey beard and very crowded front teeth. He is believed to have been living in the tent and likely died sometime in 1998.

Teeth: Good, Crowded front teeth with protrusions to eye teeth
Shirt: Green, White, FLANNEL, "Eatons" brand, checkered flannel, size L
Green, White, “The Bay” brand, Grenadier style, long sleeve, size L
Cotton, Green, "Fruit of the Loom" brand, long sleeve, size XL
Cotton, White, Green, Grenadier Bay" brand, size L
Coat: Nylon, Green, Black, “Tip Top” brand, winter coat
Wallet: Plastic, Green, Coin purse with $1.21 in Canadian coins
Glasses: Metal, Bronze, Reading glasses, “Swan” Brand frames in a blue leather style case
Luggage: Nylon, Black, “California Pak” brand sports bag
Jacket: Nylon, Green, White, "Club International by Tip Top” brand, size M
Shoes: Leather, Brown, "Road Work" brand boots, Vibram soles, made in 1996, size 10

Case reference: 2014002562.CaseDesc: Michael Megraw, from Minnesota, USA, had visited the Katamik Lake area with his brother to go fishing over the September Labour Day weekend in September 1992.  Michael had returned to the US but was reported missing just days later, family indicated he was last seen on September 11, 1992.  RCMP received a call on October 3, 1992, about a truck at Katamik Lake which didn't appear to have been moved since September 24th; Mr. Megraw was determined to be the registered owner.  It is believed he returned to the lake somewhere between September 11 and September 24, 1992. Mr. Megraw has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2015011633.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2000, a man's body was recovered in the middle of the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in Pointe-aux-Trembles. According to experts, the body was not in the water for a long time.

Sweater: Cotton, White, T-shirt with "Le ciel peut attendre" written on the front and "CPA-VIH" written on the back

Case reference: 2014004517.CaseDesc: Edmee (Eva) Mitchell, 83 years old, went missing on August 20, 2004. Mrs. Mitchell was last seen at her rural residence near Kelly Lake, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003777.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1988, François Piquet was seen for the last time when he left the family residence located in the Saint-Laurent district of Montreal, Quebec. François left his ID cards behind and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014000001.CaseDesc: Emma Fillipoff was last seen in the Victoria Inner Harbour area on November 28, 2012.  She was reported to be a shy and quiet person and had been staying at a local shelter for about 6 months prior to her going missing. It is believed that Emma may have been suffering from the onset of some mental health issues. She was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes.  Emma did not use or abuse drugs or alcohol.

Luggage: Canvas, Other, Light coloured canvas bag
Shoes: Blue, Grey, Was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes

Case reference: 2014001095.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 11, 1998, the body of an adult female believed to be between the ages of 30-40, with long dark hair and blue eyes was found deceased at the Broadway SkyTrain Station in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was very lean and pale and was wearing a long red wool coat over jeans and black ankle boots.

Coat: Wool, Red, Long coat with hood

Case reference: 2016061955.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1975, the body of a Caucasian male was found wedged in between a wooden fence and a pillar on King Street East, in Toronto. His appendix is present. An autopsy determined that this man was an alcoholic.

Teeth: Stained, His teeth were in poor condition with no dental work present and stains indicate that he was a smoker.
Other: Knife with a white handle 4" long
Watch: Timex watch, black dial with a date indicator. There is a red cross in middle of the dial.

Case reference: 2014003787.CaseDesc: Jo Ann Comeau, was last seen on February 9th, 2001, in Saint John, NB. Joanne suffers from Muscular Dystrophy and walks with an unsteady gait.

Case reference: 2017029343.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2017, Patrick Wall was last seen at his home in Wetaskiwin County, Alberta. His abandoned vehicle was located in Edmonton, also in Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2014003882.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1991, Marcel Paquette was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec when he left in his car to visit his family in the Gaspésie region. His vehicle was located near the city of Causapscal, Quebec. Marcel is diabetic and may have memory problems.

Tattoo: Right Chest, Devil and "Renee et Marie" in text
Left Chest, Heart and "Diane" in text

Case reference: 2014002748.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1981, Jerry Torarak was last seen at 11:15 p.m. He had been travelling back to Hopedale, NL from Railroads, NL via boat with family. Approximately 15 miles off shore from Hopedale, Jerry fell over board into the water and sank out of sight.

Case reference: 2014003620.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1980, Arthur Keefe was travelling with a friend on snowmobile when the pair went through the ice and into the water. His friend managed to climb out, but Mr. Keefe went under and it is not known whether he resurfaced.

Case reference: 2008023299.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2001, Istefan Toma returned home after work. He showered, changed his clothes and was observed leaving the family home at approximately 1 a.m. in his own vehicle. It was later discovered he had taken his identification and citizenship card, but did not take any clothing or other belongings with him. His vehicle was recovered from a parking lot in the vicinity of his work place at Woodbridge Mall (Hwy 7/Martingrove, Woodbridge, Ontario) on the 11th of February 2002, having been parked there for approximately 6-9 months. Mr. Toma has not been in contact with any family members nor his employers since he left his home on the morning of June 30, 2001. Mr. Toma speaks broken English, is known to smoke DuMaurier cigarettes and has been known to attend casinos on occasion. Mr. Toma's family and the police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Mark: Nose, Mole on the right side of the nose

Case reference: 2016068138.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1985, a male was recovered from the Detroit River near Cooper's Marina in the township of Anderdon, County Essex, 5 km north of Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 190-200lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has no obvious scars or tattoos and is uncircumcised. Police believe that this individual is American, based on the clothing labels. It is thought that he had been in the water for as long as two months.

Hair: Black, A small amount of hair was also present on his chin.
Teeth: Most of his teeth are present and there are several amalgam (silver) restorations.
Belt: Leather, Brown, with rivets and a pattern on the leather
Shirt: Gold, Hudson Sport Detroit, short-sleeved  sport shirt with three buttons at the neck
Sweater: Gold, Arnold Palmer Design USA, cardigan
Jacket: Beige, St. John's Bay, hooded with a zipper in front; made in Korea
Hat: Wool, Red, Brown, woolen toque in his pocket

Case reference: 2021039122.CaseDesc: In June 1961, Robert Heard was seen for the last time walking in the forest near his farm located on Pot Hole Road in Eby Township, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Robert was experiencing a decline in his mental capacity.

Case reference: 2014005026.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2007, Eric Cox was seen for the last time when he boarded the Marine Atlantic Ferry in North Sydney, Nova Scotia heading to Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005592.CaseDesc: The Timmins Police Service is actively investigating a historical missing person case involving the disappearance of William “Billy” Chookomolin. Mr. Chookomolin went missing from Timmins in the spring of 1995 at the age of 47.

Case reference: 2014001214.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2012, the skeleton of a woman was discovered on the banks of the Rivière des Prairies, on the south side of Montreal near Gouin Street.

Case reference: 2014002095.CaseDesc: On May 10, 1980 four men from Grand Forks, North Dakota departed in a boat from the Anama Bay Tourist Camp (Manitoba) for a fishing trip. At approximately 2:45 p.m. on this date an overturned boat was spotted in the Sturgeon Bay area of Lake Winnipeg. The bodies of three of the four men were found. The cause of death for all three of these men was death due to cold exposure (in water) and drowning. The body of William Winters was never recovered. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014004957.CaseDesc: On New Year's Eve, 2002 an anonymous letter was received by the Vancouver Police Department. The letter referred to a female Vancouver sex trade worker who had disappeared one month earlier, at the end of November. The letter writer described the woman, admitted to killing her, and apologized to her family for taking her life. Investigators believe the letter writer was referring to Danielle Marissa Larue, and while her body has never been found, they believe that she was murdered. The letter writer knows what happened to Danielle, and police are hopeful that the writer will contact them again.

Case reference: 2006019099.CaseDesc: Janet Derbyshire was last seen on December 4, 1976, in St. Joseph Island near Sault Ste. Marie, ON.  She was  seen jumping off the St. Joseph's Island Bridge into the  water. She was seen floating downstream for approximately .25 miles before she submerged under water. Janet Derbyshire is presumed drowned but her body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2012020079.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1991, Lavina Tocher, 35 years old, was last seen in Parkman, SK. On the 12th of December of that year, Ms. Tocher was reported missing by an anonymous caller. Investigation and searches have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2006020299.CaseDesc: Mary Ann Copeman was last seen on September 5, 1993 when she left to go on a recreational walk. Ms. Copeman was known to have mental health issues and may have been in a confused state. She was walking in the vicinity of Fifth Street in Balmertown, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000013.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1967, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Marianne Schuett was seen for the last time in the vicinity of the Kilbride Public School's driveway in North Burlington, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Marianne was seen talking to an unknown man in a vehicle, and it is believed that she was abducted by this man.

Hair: Brown, Bangs in front, ear length at back

Case reference: 2017047885.CaseDesc: On July 31, 2017, Brayden Thibault was seen for the last time when he left Fredericton, New-Brunswick to meet someone in the City of Moncton, New-Brunswick. Brayden has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006018899.CaseDesc: William Bowman was last seen leaving his hunting camp, 83 kilometres north of the Town of Massey, Ontario, at the north end of Hwy.# 810, District Algoma, Monestine Township on October 15, 1979.

Case reference: 2016069147.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1974, the body of a Caucasian male was found on the CNR tracks, 200 yards west of the CNR Station, Hearst. A witness observed the remains on the tracks after an advancing train had passed. His post-mortem length was recorded as being 5’8” however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was described as having a medium build. He may have been wearing glasses according to police reports.

Teeth: Good, Missing upper left 3rd molar. Several of his upper and lower posterior teeth had amalgam restorations.

Case reference: 2014041193.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2014, Colten Pratt was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014004742.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2006, Michael James Bosma left on foot from a care home located on Bernard Avenue in Kelowna, BC and failed to return.  Mr. Bosma had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and required essential medication.  ATM activity was recorded on his account during the night and early morning hours following his departure then all traces of him ceased.

Case reference: 2014005316.CaseDesc: On March 31, 2002, Jenifer Morse was seen for the last time when she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004714.CaseDesc: In May 1975, William Lindsay was seen for the last time in Field, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, William, also known as Larry, had cashed in a federal tax refund cheque at a corner store. Prior to his disappearance in 1972, he had completed the Air Force’s basic training course (#7214) in Cornwallis, Nova Scotia, and then enrolled in the Communication Systems Tech course.

Scar: Cheek, Small crescent shaped on the left side

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2008008498.CaseDesc: Helen Lipinski went to the Roman Court Bingo Hall with her daughter. She stepped out of the hall, leaving her purse behind. Mrs. Lipinski has a history of mental health issues. She previously mentioned wanting to visit her sister in Chihuahua, Mexico.

Jewelry: Gold, birthstone with 7 stones, 1 was missing

Case reference: 2015006607.CaseDesc: Peter Russell Yellowbird was reported missing by his family after they became concerned that he had been out of contact for so long. It is believed that Mr. Yellowbird’s last known location was in the Downtown area of Edmonton. Mr. Yellowbird’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being. There are no indications to suggest foul play.

Case reference: 2016061152.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1990, a male was found in the Detroit River, in LaSalle. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for approximately two months.

Socks: White, blue and red horizontal rings at top
Suit: Wool, Maroon, two-piece jogging suit with no pockets
